body:
@rdhabalia  I did the test by using : 
 * Broker 1.22.1 
  * Producer 1.22 (perf-producer)
  * Consumer from master (2.2-SNAPSHOT) (perf-consumer)

I could no reproduce the issue. There are no unacked messages. Do you have a better way to reproduce?

> The code should already be sending 1 single ack if the broker is < 2.0 :

I see, I missed it to check.

I think the issue is that I have cherry-picked [ActiveConsumerListener-change](https://github.com/apache/incubator-pulsar/pull/1156) into broker-1.22 to support function on broker-1.22 and this PR upgraded pulsar-broker version=`V12` and because of that client was sending group-ack to broker which broker couldn't understand.
Thanks for pointing it out, I will fix internal broker's patch.
Thanks for the work @aahmed-se , looking forward to it.
retest this please // watch-znode script threw an exception which allowed brokers to start to early which messed up the init script

> Might be worthwhile to go over this in detail about what we are trying to achieve and why there are so many touch points

actually, getAndReset doesn't store any sample because it gets current sample and resets it. right now, it is only used by prometheus to feed into metrics. but if we want to fetch metrics on demand then we want to update metrics (reset) periodically and get metrics on demand. PR #2130 in created on top of this one which aggregates metrics into function stats so, we can always see function metrics on demand using getMetrics api similar like we can get for topic: pulsar-admin persistent stats <topic> which gives current topic stats using cli api. also, we can add additional REST api which can generate metrics in different format other than prometheus.
This issue is not needed anymore. so close it.
based on the discussion before, we don't want to support bytes key. current string key is already enough to support bytes. so close it for now.
@rdhabalia The test failure seems to be genuine

`FunctionStatsGeneratorTest.testFunctionsStatsGenerate`
yes, I have fixed it in previous PR #2128 so, it will be fixed once I will rebase it.
@srkukarni made change to keep schedule-task configurable.
@sijie Yes, created  #2141 to track the issue that causes the test to fail.
I have rebased the PR, and addressed the discussed changes. any more concern before we merge PR?

I am not sure if its better to make the metrics gathering more complicated here.  I do like to paradigm of an external system keeping track of intervals and metrics of intervals and functions only do very simple bookkeeping.  Even to keep the last 60 secs snapshot, why can't we offload this to an external system or even another function? Is it even useful for admins to see the last 60 secs of metrics? With only the last 60 secs of metrics, it seems to me, that only if you get lucky and get the metrics at the right time will you be only able to find problems.

If we are wanting to keep metrics in any sort of time bucket, we can even have a system function that users can start to collect all of the metrics for all functions and aggregate them into whatever time buckets we want and maybe the UI can even query the function to get the stats for display

>  I do like to paradigm of an external system keeping track of intervals and metrics

had a quick chat with @srkukarni on it and added last change to keep it configurable (it supports external-system update and internal both). 
in very brief, if external-system (eg. prometheus) resets metrics and gets the metrics then metrics will be wiped out immediately and system will not have any sample-observation. so, if immediately after prometheus gets metrics if anyone wants to get metrics using cli-command then it will not be able to get it. Best example is: Pulsar cli-stats-command which keeps one sample of metrics. also, it is useful when you don't have prometheus setup and if you want to know your metrics number then also it helps to get metrics numbers.
@rdhabalia but the metrics is for only the last 60 secs right?

> but the metrics is for only the last 60 secs right?

Yes, function will keep only 1 sample (which is last 1 minute) so, at any-point of time admin can check current stats (eg: msgRateOut, msgRateIn).

I am just unsure that last 60 secs of metrics is going to be any more useful for a user then a simple status check to find out whether the function running or not or has any exceptions thrown.  Like I mentioned before,  if a user can get only the last 60 secs of metrics, the user would either have to get lucky and query at the right time to see any problems or keep checking every 60 secs.  

Though if other/users think it is useful,  I am completely ok with this going in

TestCompaction should be ready and passing
TestS3Offload is code ready is not passing yet , we probably to redesign the start and stop sequences.

> Like I mentioned before, if a user can get only the last 60 secs of metrics, the user would either have to get lucky and query at the right time

No that won't happen. function will always keep 1 sample of observation in one bucket and there will be another bucket for current on-going metrics. so, at any point of time user will get last 1 sample so, there will never be a conflict.
Please read ReadMe.md in the protobuf directory, which will teach you how to build.

> TestCompaction should be ready and passing

if TestCompaction is passing, please split this PR into two parts. we can review TestCompaction separately. These two modules doesn't make sense to be combined as one whole PR from beginning.
It should be ready I am able get the test pass locally
This PR might just need a rebase
@hrsakai Please rebase on latest master, so it should fix the build
@aahmed-se FYI we have LocalStackContainer in Testcontainers which helps you to run S3-compatible API for the testing :)
@bsideup we tried the LocalStack the s3 operations didn't work as expected.
@sijie @ivankelly seems a lot of changes have happened in master gonna rebuild the git commits to resolve the complicated conflicts.

@sijie I tested the command and below are the results. It works fine. If you are referring to the functionality, I tested it and seeing duplicates published and consumed. I will create a separate issue for it. 
`
$> pulsar-admin namespaces set-deduplication \
>   persistent://my-tenant/ns1/my-card-topic \
>   --enable
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid namespace format. namespace: persistent://my-tenant/ns1/my-card-topic
	at org.apache.pulsar.common.naming.NamespaceName.<init>(NamespaceName.java:100)
	at org.apache.pulsar.common.naming.NamespaceName.<init>(NamespaceName.java:32)
	at org.apache.pulsar.common.naming.NamespaceName$1.load(NamespaceName.java:44)
	at org.apache.pulsar.common.naming.NamespaceName$1.load(NamespaceName.java:41)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LoadingValueReference.loadFuture(LocalCache.java:3628)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.loadSync(LocalCache.java:2336)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.lockedGetOrLoad(LocalCache.java:2295)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.get(LocalCache.java:2208)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.get(LocalCache.java:4053)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.getOrLoad(LocalCache.java:4057)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LocalLoadingCache.get(LocalCache.java:4986)
	at org.apache.pulsar.common.naming.NamespaceName.get(NamespaceName.java:65)
	at org.apache.pulsar.admin.cli.CliCommand.validateNamespace(CliCommand.java:43)
	
$> pulsar-admin namespaces set-deduplication \
>   my-tenant/ns1 \
>   --enable
`
